episodes.title: I needed to join her, otherwise the world would end | SBS Insight
episodes.description:
Insight delves into the enduring allure of cults and similar groups, questioning whether more should be done to shield people from their influence. Shannon, who acknowledges qualities of a cult leader in herself, provides her perspective. Othniel recounts his immersion in a Bible study group in Australia, where intense scripture study caused him to abandon his university education. Andy, Othniel's friend, recounts his efforts to help him escape. Sandra shares her struggles as her daughter becomes involved in a cult, abandoning her job and education. Shona recounts her experiences working for a marketing firm that promoted extreme weight loss among employees, leading her to therapy for anorexia. Maddy draws parallels between her former beauty pageant experiences and cult dynamics. Muareen reflects on her positive experiences in Alcoholics Anonymous, likening it to a "good cult." Sam describes his departure from a church due to its cult-like pressures and discriminatory views. Carlie shares her legal victory after being sued by a former cult leader for defamation. Esther discusses her activism against abuse within a healing clinic, highlighting challenges in seeking justice. Laura shares her journey leaving as a fifth-generation member.

Insight airs Tuesdays at 8:30pm on SBS:  http://www.sbs.com.au/news/insight​

SUBSCRIBE: https://bit.ly/3txZoUN

Insight, hosted by Kumi Taguchi, is Australia's leading forum for powerful first-person stories offering a unique perspective on the way we live.

Insight first went to air in 1995 and has since been a mainstay of SBS current affairs programming. The team doesn't shy away from taboo topics: from polygamy, to brain implants, to the secrets revealed on the deathbed.
